item.title: Revolutionary women of the PSL on the frontlines of the struggle...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Revolutionary women of the PSL on the frontlines of the struggle ‚úäüö©

Party for Socialism and Liberation - PSL

In celebration of the 10th issue of Breaking the Chains magazine, we want to showcase the amazing women who not only create this magazine but also put theory in...to practice by organizing in the streets! From Los Angeles to Boston, women are on the frontlines of the rebellion against racism and police violence. As unemployment and COVID-19 cases continue to rise, women have shown that they are not only essential workers but are essential to revolution! We will continue to mobilize in the streets and build towards a feminist and socialist future, because the struggle for women's liberation is part and parcel of the liberation of ALL workers!

Get the latest copy of Breaking the Chains magazine, "From Capitalist Cages to Socialist Liberation", at pslweb.org/store

See More
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Check out the Denver Police Department putting on an ice cream...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Check out the Denver Police Department putting on an ice cream social to draw parents and kids out to meet "Officer Friendly". It's more important than ever to the police to do PR with the parts of the community disconnected enough from their brutality to believe they're really here to "protect and serve".

The truth is that DPD is not family-friendly. They are not sweet or cuddly. Denver police murdered William Debose, Paul Childs, Dion Damon, Michael Marshall, Jason Gomez, J...esse Hernandez, Marvin Booker, Paul Castaway, Ryan Ronquillo, Joseph Valverde, Odiceo Valencia-Lopez, Naeschylus Carter-Vinzant, and many more. They have brutalized countless members of our community and put many more behind bars. They have spent the summer brutally repressing the anti-racist protest movement.

These PR stunts are repulsive, but they will not be enough to stop the advance of consciousness around the true nature of the police.

See More

item.title: The plight of people behind bars in the U.S. during the...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

The plight of people behind bars in the U.S. during the coronavirus pandemic is dire. Prisoners and detainees are getting sick and dying at highly elevated rates, and without immediate and sweeping action, mass deaths‚Äîdisproportionately of poor, Black, Brown, and Indigenous people‚Äîare a certainty. This is why PSL Denver is backing tomorrow‚Äôs Decarceration Day of Action, organized by the Colorado ACLU and endorsed by more than 50 local organizations.

Join the rally at noon tomorrow at the capitol, and demand Governor Polis immediately release all elderly, vulnerable, non-dangerous, and non-convicted inmates and all ICE detainees!
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: The plight of people behind bars in the U.S. during the...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

The plight of people behind bars in the U.S. during the coronavirus pandemic is dire. Prisoners and detainees are getting sick and dying at highly elevated rates, and without immediate and sweeping action, mass deaths‚Äîdisproportionately of poor, Black, Brown, and Indigenous people‚Äîare a certainty. This is why PSL Denver is backing tomorrow‚Äôs Decarceration Day of Action. Join the rally at noon tomorrow at the capitol and read Dr. Apryl Alexander‚Äôs opinion piece on the day of a...ction in the Denver Post.

‚ÄúAfter briefly allowing increased prisoner releases, the governor has rescinded that authority and refuses to exercise any of his broad powers to safely reduce the prison population.

Surely, the governor is aware that the United States incarcerates people at a higher rate than any other country in the world, and that mass incarceration has destroyed Black communities, without improving public safety. Surely he is aware that our carceral system is founded on racist principles, and the racial make-up of our prisons is a reflection of historical and ongoing systemic racism.

Yet, rather than acknowledging the humanity of people living behind bars and the racism underlying the prison system, Gov. Polis has contributed to a public narrative that demonizes incarcerated people as unredeemable and too dangerous to be free. When advocates called for thoughtful releases of vulnerable incarcerated people, Gov. Polis‚Äô response: He would not ‚Äúlet dangerous criminals out.‚Äù

Come on, governor. No one wants you to release ‚Äúdangerous criminals.‚Äù We all want to be safe. That‚Äôs why advocates have been calling for the release of people who are elderly, sick, or have otherwise proven they are not a public safety threat. Decades of mass incarceration has ensured that there are many such people in Colorado‚Äôs prisons, and racism has ensured that those people will be disproportionately Black.

Here‚Äôs just one example: Ron Johnson is a 62-year-old Black grandfather who has turned his life around in prison. He suffers from asthma, high blood pressure, and uses an inhaler to breathe, so he is at high risk for COVID. He is no threat to the public. He lives in an incentive unit where he cares for other incarcerated people with medical disabilities and mentors incarcerated people earning their GED.‚Äù

See MoreBlack people living behind bars face a racist double whammy ‚Äì because of their blackness they are more likely to be imprisoned, more likely to get COVID, and more likely to die from the virus.

denverpost.com

Guest commentary: If Black lives matter to him, Polis needs to reduce prison population

Black people living behind bars face a racist double whammy ‚Äì because of their blackness they are more likely to be imprisoned, more likely to get COVID, and more likely to die from the virus.Black people living behind bars face a racist double whammy ‚Äì because of their blackness they are more likely to be imprisoned, more likely to get COVID, and more likely to die from the virus.

item.title: Cops and the Klan go hand-in-hand. WATCH THIS CLIP! This footage...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Cops and the Klan go hand-in-hand. WATCH THIS CLIP! This footage was taken 15 minutes before the Kenosha shooter Kyle Rittenhouse murdered two anti-racist protesters and injured a third. The cops offer the armed white supremacist vigilantes water (Rittenhouse is the one walking over to get water), and thank them for what they are doing. At the very same time, they are ordering protesters to clear the streets. 15 minutes later Kyle Rittenhouse shot 3 protesters, gave a hand si...gn to the cops, and walked right past 3 police vehicles without even being stopped.

As the system tries to clamp down on the anti-racist uprising sweeping the country, the police keep further exposing that they are not an institution with the purpose of protecting our communities, but a violent repressive force dedicated to upholding a white supremacist order. They will join forces with openly racist elements of the population who will aid them in accomplishing this task.

The anti-racist uprising of people in this country is a real threat to white supremacy, and this country‚Äôs rulers know it! Keep up the fight!

See More‚ÄúLOOK AT THIS CLIP! LOOK! THEY ARE WORKING ALONGSIDE THE POLICE https://t.co/BPL5clfjrc‚Äù

twitter.com

A Friendly Dad on Twitter

‚ÄúLOOK AT THIS CLIP! LOOK! THEY ARE WORKING ALONGSIDE THE POLICE https://t.co/BPL5clfjrc‚Äù‚ÄúLOOK AT THIS CLIP! LOOK! THEY ARE WORKING ALONGSIDE THE POLICE https://t.co/BPL5clfjrc‚Äù

item.title: In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, Quierza Lewis began...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, Quierza Lewis began organizing as inmates were dying, guards were without protective equipment and social distancing an impossibility in an overcrowded prison ‚Äî especially Angola the largest maximum-security prison in the United States.

Since his email communications with outside organizers were discovered by officials, Quierza has been placed in administrative segregation‚Äìsolitary. Two other inmates who were also in communication with th...e same activist were not targeted by the prison system.

When the prison system moved to place Quierza in solitary in May there were already eight COVID-19 deaths among inmates with life sentences in Angola.

https://www.liberationnews.org/its-a-death-trap-angola-inm‚Ä¶/

See More‚ÄúBecause of COVID, you know, many are at risk due to pre-existing conditions...." #COVID19 #lousiana #Massincarceration

liberationnews.org

‚ÄòIt‚Äôs a death trap:‚Äô Angola inmate put in isolation for organizing...

item.title: The Democratic National Convention proves exactly how far right...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

The Democratic National Convention proves exactly how far right the Democrat Party continues to move. It was also an exercise in cowardly fear in the face of Trump‚Äôs open redbaiting and Muslim baiting. That was the stated reason that the party‚Äôs most popular liberal member of the House, Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, received just 90 seconds to speak. That‚Äôs precisely why the Biden team joined in Trump‚Äôs condemnation of Palestinian activist Linda Sarsour after she spoke as an invited guest on a panel discussion at the convention. That‚Äôs why Republican billionaires, militarists and anti-abortion politicians were given major roles.

Convention highlights war makers, marginalizes progressives. #elections

liberationnews.org

Convention: Having squelched left, DNC pivots hard right

Convention highlights war makers, marginalizes progressives. #electionsConvention highlights war makers, marginalizes progressives. #elections
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: This Black August, there can be no doubt that the conditions...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

This Black August, there can be no doubt that the conditions that George Jackson and the prisoners of the Attica Rebellion lost their lives rebelling against in 1971 are still in place today. The neglect this government shows to Black, Brown, Indigenous, LGBTQ+ and poor folks on a daily basis is doubled behind prison walls, and tripled under pandemic conditions.

Today we brought our protest to the Denver County Jail, the Denver Women‚Äôs Correctional Facility, and the Aurora G...EO ICE Detention Center. Though this system tries to hide the horrendous abuse that happens behind bars out of sight, we will not leave behind those in cages in our struggle. We raise the following demands, recognizing that if they are not met, more unnecessary death is a certainty:

1. Immediate humanitarian release of all ICE detainees and all vulnerable inmates, those convicted for non-violent offenses, and those who have not been convicted at all.

2. Where people remain behind bars, drastically increase medical staffing and supplies to local jails and state prisons, and guarantee sanitary conditions for all inmates.

3. Free all political prisoners!

Thank you to Black Lives Matter 5280, Sanctuary4All Colorado for cohosting this event! #FreeThemAll #LiberaATodos

See More+9
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: On Saturday, July 25, a protest we organized to demand justice...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

On Saturday, July 25, a protest we organized to demand justice for Elijah McClain was violently attacked by two white men who attempted to drive a Jeep through a crowd of hundreds of anti-racist protesters. The two men were not arrested, but instead were given assistance by police and let go. This attack was nothing less than white supremacist terrorism intended to halt the advance of the anti-racist struggle. Just as white supremacy resisted the advance towards equality duri...ng Reconstruction and the Civil Rights movement, so it does today. It is critical that in these moments, we stand together as a community and demonstrate our commitment to carrying forward the struggle against racism.

Join us August 30 for a march bringing together Denver and Aurora to demonstrate our unity and determination in the fight against racism and police violence. Attendees are invited to march on foot or in their cars. Please stay tuned for opportunities to volunteer and otherwise support this event. If you are a community leader or part of an organization that would like to endorse this demonstration, please message us!

Event page: https://facebook.com/events/351526215840428/
